public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the reduction of burdens resulting from legislation for businesses or other organisations or for individuals; to make provision for the repeal or amendment of regulations; to make provision about the exercise of regulatory powers and functions; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Deregulation

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the carrying out of the functions of the Prime Minister in the event that a Prime Minister, or a person temporarily carrying out the functions of the Prime Minister, is incapacitated; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Prime Minister (Temporary Replacement)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the abolition of the Department for International Development and the Government Equalities Office; to make provision for the abolition of the Office of the Secretary of State for Wales, Scotland Office and Northern Ireland Office; to establish a Department for the Nations of the United Kingdom in their place; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Government Departments (Abolition)

public_bills.description: A Bill to enable the maximum turnover threshold for exemption from the requirement to register for VAT to be raised; to make provision for the exemption of certain goods and services from liability to VAT; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Value Added Tax

public_bills.description: A Bill to require the carrying out and publication of reviews of the level of public expenditure in connection with the High Speed 2 rail line (Phase 1); to establish procedures in connection with changes in these levels; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: High Speed 2 Phase 1 (Reviews of Public Expenditure)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the privatisation of the British Broadcasting Corporation and Channel 4; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Public Service Broadcasters (Privatisation)

public_bills.description: A Bill to require persons bringing claims or proceedings under the Human Rights Act 1998 to satisfy a test of reasonableness and equity; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Human Rights and Responsibilities

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision about holiday pay for employees; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Holiday Pay

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the expiration of the Working Time Regulations 1998; to provide for regulations governing working time; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Working Time (Regulations)

public_bills.description: A Bill to limit the rate of interest chargeable on outstanding student loan debt; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Student Loans (Debt Interest)

public_bills.description: A Bill to prohibit persons from being registered to vote in Parliamentary elections in more than one constituency; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Voter Registration

public_bills.description: A Bill to authorise the use of resources for the year ending with 31 March 2018; to authorise both the issue of sums out of the Consolidated Fund and the application of income for that year; and to appropriate the supply authorised for that year by this Act and by the Supply and Appropriation (Anticipation and Adjustments) Act 2017.
public_bills.title: Supply and Appropriation (Main Estimates)

public_bills.description:
A bill to impose certain duties upon Her Majesty’s Government to ensure the accuracy, completeness and utility of electoral registers; to make provision for the sharing of data for the purposes
of electoral registration; and for connected purposes.
public_bills.title: Automatic Electoral Registration

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the target for reducing net carbon emissions in the UK to 100% by 2050.

public_bills.description: A Bill to provide that the Secretary of State’s powers in relation to the management of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, include the power to grant a lease in respect of land for a period of up to 150 years
public_bills.title: Kew Gardens (Leases)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the resolution of disputes concerning the location or placement of boundaries and private rights of way relating to the title of an estate in land; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Property Boundaries (Resolution of Disputes)

public_bills.description: A Bill to provide for the High Court of England and Wales to make a preliminary finding on cases of alleged genocide; and for the subsequent referral of such findings to the International Criminal Court or a special tribunal
public_bills.title: Genocide Determination

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the Civil Partnership Act 2004 to make provision for mixed sex couples to enter into a civil partnership
public_bills.title: Civil Partnership Act 2004 (Amendment) (Mixed Sex Couples)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make further provision for transparency in supply chains in respect of slavery and human trafficking
public_bills.title: Modern Slavery (Transparency in Supply Chains)

public_bills.description: A Bill to prohibit the wearing of medals or insignia awarded for valour, with the intent to deceive
public_bills.title: Awards for Valour (Protection)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision to include medical practitioners specialising in cosmetic surgery in the Specialist Register for medical practitioners
public_bills.title: Cosmetic Surgery (Standards)

public_bills.description: A Bill to establish the BBC Licence Fee Commission to make recommendations to the Secretary of State on a settlement for BBC funding from 1 April 2022, after conducting public and parliamentary consultation
public_bills.title: BBC Licence Fee

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for unaccompanied asylum seeking children to receive legal advice and for extending the deadline for an unaccompanied asylum seeking child to appeal an asylum decision
public_bills.title: Unaccompanied Asylum Seeking Children (Legal Advice and Appeals)

public_bills.description: A Bill to permit young persons to carry out voluntary work on a heritage railway or tramway
public_bills.title: Heritage Railways and Tramways (Voluntary Work)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for disability equality and for the provision of balanced information in respect of abortions
public_bills.title: Abortion (Disability Equality)

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 to improve transparency in respect of election and referendum material
public_bills.title: Elections and Referendums (Advertising)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision about the surrender, production or other delivery up of driving licences, or test certificates, in relation to certain offences; to make provision in relation to identifying persons in connection with fixed penalty notices, conditional offers and the payment of fixed penalties under the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Road Traffic Offenders (Surrender of Driving Licences Etc)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the holding of a referendum in the United Kingdom and Gibraltar on whether the United Kingdom should accept the outcome of negotiations between the Government and the European Union regarding the United Kingdom’s exit from the European Union
public_bills.title: European Union (Referendum on the Withdrawal Agreement)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the Secretary of State to undertake a public consultation reviewing the provision of comprehensive and integrated services for adults with learning disabilities
public_bills.title: Learning Disabilities (Review of Services)

public_bills.description: A Bill to create a right to die at home
public_bills.title: Right to Die at Home

public_bills.description: A Bill to make amendments to the Marriage Act 1949 to make provision for all religious marriages to be solemnized on the authority of a superintendent registrar
public_bills.title: Marriage Act 1949 (Amendment)

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the definition of extreme pornography in the Digital Economy Act 2017
public_bills.title: Digital Economy Act 2017 (Amendment) (Definition of Extreme Pornography)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for the sale of adjustable focus spectacles
public_bills.title: Opticians Act 1989 (Amendment)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for a certificate to be issued to mothers in respect of miscarried and stillborn children not eligible for registration under the Births and Deaths Registration Act 1953; for establishing a database for archiving the certificate and recording information about the miscarriage or still birth; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Certificate of Loss

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for ensuring that police forces in England and Wales have sufficient resources to deliver police services; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Policing Resources

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for state-maintained schools to promote the mental health and well-being of their pupils alongside academic attainment
public_bills.title: Schools (Mental Health and Wellbeing)

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for specifying new statutory rights and entitlements for victims of crime under the Code of Practice for Victims of Crime; to require elected local policing bodies to assess victims services; to increase the duties of the Commissioner for Victims and Witnesses; to grant victims the right to request a review of a decision not to prosecute; to establish reviews in homicides where no criminal charge has been made; to create an obligation on professions to notify cases of possible victims of child sexual abuse; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Victims of Crime (Rights, Entitlements, and Notification of Child Sexual Abuse)

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the Immigration Act 1971 to grant indefinite leave to remain in the United Kingdom to all EEA nationals, their family members and extended family members who are resident in the United Kingdom on the date of exit from the European Union

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for Members of the House of Lords to vote in elections to the House of Commons

public_bills.description: A Bill to lower the gestational time limit for abortion to 12 weeks

public_bills.description: A Bill to extend the franchise for parliamentary and other elections to all citizens over the age of 16 years
public_bills.title: Voting Age (Reduction)

public_bills.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple as cohabitants; to make provision about the property of deceased persons who are survived by a cohabitant; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Cohabitation Rights

public_bills.description: A Bill to make provision for clinical commissioning groups to ensure that persons in their area have access to specialist and generalist palliative care and appropriate support services; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Access to Palliative Care

public_bills.description: A Bill to provide for the independence of the British Broadcasting Corporation
public_bills.title: BBC (Independence)

public_bills.description: A Bill to replace the current regime of limits on local housing authorities’ debt with limits determined by the existing prudential regime for local authority borrowing for non-housing-related purposes
public_bills.title: Local Housing Authority Debt

public_bills.description: A Bill to prohibit the publication of certain information regarding persons who have been arrested until they have been charged with an offence; to set out the circumstances where such information can be published without committing an offence; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Anonymity (Arrested Persons)

public_bills.description: A Bill to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of a peerage; to make related provision about disqualifications for voting at elections to, and for membership of, the House of Commons; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: House of Lords

public_bills.description: A Bill to amend the law regarding the succession to Peerages; and for connected purposes
public_bills.title: Succession to Peerages

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make new provision for the making of statutes for the University of London; and for related purposes.
sources_getAll.title: University of London

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend and update the powers of the Middle Level Commissioners to regulate navigation on the Middle Level of the Fens in the city of Peterborough and the counties of Cambridgeshire and Norfolk; to make further provision as to the regulation of navigation on those waterways; to make other provision as to the Commissioners; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend certain provisions of the Richmond Burgage Pastures Act 1853.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about the availability of public services during weekday evenings, at weekends and on bank holidays; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for the reduction of tariffs on goods imported into the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about the maintenance and repair of roads by local authorities in England; to make provision for prescribing the use of funds for this purpose; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about the accountability of clinical commissioning groups; to make provision about local referendums on NHS sustainability and transformation plans; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make the breach of certain rules relating to sub-letting rented accommodation a criminal offence; to make provision for criminal sanctions in respect of unauthorised sub-letting; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to require the Government to publish an annual review of the net yield to HM Treasury of tax rates and duties levied, including estimates of the impact on yield of changes to rates of those taxes and duties; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to reduce Value Added Tax on domestic energy bills; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: To amend the Parliamentary Constituencies Act 1986 to make provision about the number and size of parliamentary constituencies in the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision extending the basis on which British citizens outside the UK qualify to participate in parliamentary elections; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to restrict the rights of vessels not registered in the United Kingdom to fish in territorial waters; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for the reduction of stamp duty rates on residential property.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about the forgiveness or discharge of student loan debt in certain circumstances; to make provision about the treatment of student loan debt in bankruptcy proceedings; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to introduce more freedom, flexibility and opportunity for those seeking employment in the public and private sector; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to create offences in respect of persons that have entered the UK illegally or who have remained in the UK without legal authority; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: To facilitate the formation of an Executive in Northern Ireland by extending the time for making Ministerial appointments following the election of the Northern Ireland Assembly on 2 March 2017; and to make provision about the exercise of governmental functions in, or in relation to, Northern Ireland in the absence of Northern Ireland Ministers.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to housing; to make provision about housing space and thermal performance standards; to place a duty on the Secretary of State to require the provision of serviced plots of land; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to prohibit dealing in ivory, and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: To provide that opposite sex couples may enter a civil partnership; to make provision about the registration of the names of the mother of each party to a marriage or civil partnership; to make provision about the registration of stillborn deaths; to give coroners the power to investigate stillborn deaths; and for connected purposes.

sources_getAll.description: To make provision for and in connection with offences relating to offensive weapons.

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about whiplash claims and the personal injury discount rate.

sources_getAll.title: Unaccompanied Asylum Seeking Children (Legal Advice and Appeals)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to permit young persons to carry out voluntary work on a heritage railway or tramway
sources_getAll.title: Heritage Railways and Tramways (Voluntary Work)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for disability equality and for the provision of balanced information in respect of abortions
sources_getAll.title: Abortion (Disability Equality)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 to improve transparency in respect of election and referendum material
sources_getAll.title: Elections and Referendums (Advertising)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision about the surrender, production or other delivery up of driving licences, or test certificates, in relation to certain offences; to make provision in relation to identifying persons in connection with fixed penalty notices, conditional offers and the payment of fixed penalties under the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Road Traffic Offenders (Surrender of Driving Licences Etc)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for the holding of a referendum in the United Kingdom and Gibraltar on whether the United Kingdom should accept the outcome of negotiations between the Government and the European Union regarding the United Kingdom’s exit from the European Union
sources_getAll.title: European Union (Referendum on the Withdrawal Agreement)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for the Secretary of State to undertake a public consultation reviewing the provision of comprehensive and integrated services for adults with learning disabilities
sources_getAll.title: Learning Disabilities (Review of Services)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to create a right to die at home
sources_getAll.title: Right to Die at Home

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make amendments to the Marriage Act 1949 to make provision for all religious marriages to be solemnized on the authority of a superintendent registrar
sources_getAll.title: Marriage Act 1949 (Amendment)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend the definition of extreme pornography in the Digital Economy Act 2017
sources_getAll.title: Digital Economy Act 2017 (Amendment) (Definition of Extreme Pornography)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for the sale of adjustable focus spectacles
sources_getAll.title: Opticians Act 1989 (Amendment)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for a certificate to be issued to mothers in respect of miscarried and stillborn children not eligible for registration under the Births and Deaths Registration Act 1953; for establishing a database for archiving the certificate and recording information about the miscarriage or still birth; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Certificate of Loss

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for ensuring that police forces in England and Wales have sufficient resources to deliver police services; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Policing Resources

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for state-maintained schools to promote the mental health and well-being of their pupils alongside academic attainment
sources_getAll.title: Schools (Mental Health and Wellbeing)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for specifying new statutory rights and entitlements for victims of crime under the Code of Practice for Victims of Crime; to require elected local policing bodies to assess victims services; to increase the duties of the Commissioner for Victims and Witnesses; to grant victims the right to request a review of a decision not to prosecute; to establish reviews in homicides where no criminal charge has been made; to create an obligation on professions to notify cases of possible victims of child sexual abuse; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Victims of Crime (Rights, Entitlements, and Notification of Child Sexual Abuse)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend the Immigration Act 1971 to grant indefinite leave to remain in the United Kingdom to all EEA nationals, their family members and extended family members who are resident in the United Kingdom on the date of exit from the European Union
sources_getAll.title: EEA Nationals (Indefinite Leave to Remain)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for Members of the House of Lords to vote in elections to the House of Commons
sources_getAll.title: Extension of Franchise (House of Lords)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to lower the gestational time limit for abortion to 12 weeks
sources_getAll.title: Abortion (Foetus Protection)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to extend the franchise for parliamentary and other elections to all citizens over the age of 16 years
sources_getAll.title: Voting Age (Reduction)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple as cohabitants; to make provision about the property of deceased persons who are survived by a cohabitant; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Cohabitation Rights

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to make provision for clinical commissioning groups to ensure that persons in their area have access to specialist and generalist palliative care and appropriate support services; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Access to Palliative Care

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to provide for the independence of the British Broadcasting Corporation
sources_getAll.title: BBC (Independence)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to replace the current regime of limits on local housing authorities’ debt with limits determined by the existing prudential regime for local authority borrowing for non-housing-related purposes
sources_getAll.title: Local Housing Authority Debt

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to prohibit the publication of certain information regarding persons who have been arrested until they have been charged with an offence; to set out the circumstances where such information can be published without committing an offence; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Anonymity (Arrested Persons)

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of a peerage; to make related provision about disqualifications for voting at elections to, and for membership of, the House of Commons; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: House of Lords

sources_getAll.description: A Bill to amend the law regarding the succession to Peerages; and for connected purposes
sources_getAll.title: Succession to Peerages
